Title: Shell maintains expectation of first LNG cargo from LNG Canada by mid-2025
Description: Shell still expects to ship first LNG cargo from the 14 mtpa LNG Canada export project in British Columbia by the middle of 2025.
Author: JS

Title: VTTI aims for Zeeland Energy Terminal FID in first-half 2027, startup in second-half 2028
Description: Netherlands-based energy storage provider VTTI aims to make a final investment decision on its Zeeland Energy Terminal project in the port of Vlissingen in the Netherlands’ southwestern province of Zeeland in the first half of 2027, with commercial operations expected to begin in the second half of 2028. If approved, the proposed terminal would be the country’s third LNG import facility.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s LNG imports slump in October after a three-month high in September
Description: Japan’s LNG receipts fell sharply in October after reaching a three-month high in September as a slight easing in temperatures probably led the country’s utility firms to rely more on their contracted long-term supplies to meet demand.
Author: CK

Title: TotalEnergies reaffirms expectation for next LNG supply wave starting in 2027
Description: TotalEnergies continues to anticipate that the next wave of LNG supplies will commence in 2027, or potentially in the second half of 2026, due to various project delays.
Author: CK

Title: Mozambique LNG project on 'right track' as G7 funding approvals awaited: TotalEnergies
Description: TotalEnergies is awaiting funding approval from credit agencies in the Group of Seven industrialized nations as one of several key steps before restarting its stalled 13.1 mtpa Mozambique LNG project in Afungi in northern Mozambique’s Cabo Delgado province. The firm maintains that the project is on the right track.
Author: CK
